data.Sentence_cn: 课文26  地球上的昔日生命
data.Sentence: --- Lesson 26 The past life of the earth

data.Sentence_cn: 保存任何生物遗体的主要条件是什么?
data.Sentence: What is the main condition for the preservation of the remains of any living creature?

data.Sentence_cn: 只有生活在水中或水边的动植物尸体最有可能被保存下来，
data.Sentence: It is animals and plants which lived in or near water whose remains are most likely to be preserved,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为保存的必要条件之一是迅速掩埋，
data.Sentence: for one of the necessary conditions of preservation is quick burial,

data.Sentence_cn: 所以只有在海洋和江河里，有时在湖泊里，
data.Sentence: and it is only in the seas and rivers, and sometimes lakes,

data.Sentence_cn: 泥沙不停淤积，
data.Sentence: where mud and silt have been continuously deposited,

data.Sentence_cn: 尸体之类的东西才能被迅速地覆盖而保存下来。
data.Sentence: that bodies and the like can be rapidly covered over and preserved.

data.Sentence_cn: 即使是在最有利的环境中，
data.Sentence: But even in the most favourable circumstances

data.Sentence_cn: 死去的生物中也只有一小部分
data.Sentence: only a small fraction of the creatures that die are preserved in this way

data.Sentence_cn: 能在开始腐烂前，或更可能在被食腐动物吃掉之前，被这样保存下来。
data.Sentence: before decay sets in or, even more likely, before scavengers eat them.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为一切生物都是靠吃别的东西来活命的，
data.Sentence: After all, all living creatures live by feeding on something else,

data.Sentence_cn: 不管这种东西是植物还是动物，死的还是活的，
data.Sentence: whether it be plant or animal, dead or alive,

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，生物偶尔才能避免被吃掉的命运。
data.Sentence: and it is only by chance that such a fate is avoided.

data.Sentence_cn: 曾在陆地上生活过的动植物的遗体被保存下来的更为罕见，
data.Sentence: The remains of plants and animals that lived on land are much more rarely preserved,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为陆地上几乎没有什么东西覆盖它们。
data.Sentence: for there is seldom anything to cover them over.

data.Sentence_cn: 你可以想象出天上有看得见的飞来飞去、数不清的鸟，
data.Sentence: When you think of the innumerable birds that one sees flying about,

data.Sentence_cn: 地上有不显眼的无数的老鼠和田鼠之类的小动物，
data.Sentence: not to mention the equally numerous small animals like field mice and voles which you do not see,

data.Sentence_cn: 但是，除非在路上，很少有人遇到这些动物的尸体，
data.Sentence: it is very rarely that one comes across a dead body, except, of course, on the roads.

data.Sentence_cn: 因为它们腐败之后很快就被风化掉，或被别的动物吃掉了。
data.Sentence: They decompose and are quickly destroyed by the weather or eaten by some other creature.

data.Sentence_cn: 几乎总是由于某些特殊的条件，陆地动物的遗体才被存下来，
data.Sentence: It is almost always due to some very special circumstances that traces of land animals survive,

data.Sentence_cn: 如掉进难以到达的洞穴，或掉进冰河裂缝里，
data.Sentence: as by falling into inaccessible caves, or into an ice crevasse,

data.Sentence_cn: 或者像西伯利亚长毛象那样掉进冰窟中，
data.Sentence: like the Siberian mammoths,

data.Sentence_cn: 有时整个动物像被放在冰箱里一样被保存下来，
data.Sentence: when the whole animal is sometimes preserved, as in a refrigerator.

data.Sentence_cn: 著名的那林索夫卡长毛象就是这样被保存下来的，而且保存得很好。
data.Sentence: This is what happened to the famous Beresovka mammoth which was found preserved and in good condition.

data.Sentence_cn: 它嘴里还留着冷杉 -- 它掉进冰河裂隙折断脊椎柱之前的最后一顿饭。
data.Sentence: In his mouth were the remains of fir trees -- the last meal that he had before he fell into the crevasse and broke his back.

data.Sentence_cn: 这头长毛象已被修复，现存于圣彼得堡古生物学博物馆。
data.Sentence: The mammoth has now been restored in the Palaeontological Museum in St.Petersburg.

data.Sentence_cn: 有的动物掉进天然沥清坑里被保存下来，如在兰桥.拉.布里发现的大象、剑齿虎
data.Sentence: Other animals were trapped in tar pits, like the elephants, sabre-toothed cats,

data.Sentence_cn: 和许多其他动物，现在那里是洛杉矶的郊区。
data.Sentence: and numerous other creatures that are found at Rancho la Brea, which is now just a suburb of Los Angeles.

data.Sentence_cn: 显然，事情的经过是这样：沥青坑里积存了水，
data.Sentence: Apparently what happened was that water collected on these tar pits

data.Sentence_cn: 大象那样的大动物冒险到似乎坚固的水面上去饮水，
data.Sentence: and the bigger animals like the elephants ventured out on to the apparently firm surface to drink,

data.Sentence_cn: 立即掉进了沥青坑。
data.Sentence: and were promptly bogged in the tar.

data.Sentence_cn: 大象死后，一些食肉动物，
data.Sentence: And then, when they were dead, the carnivores,

data.Sentence_cn: 如剑齿虎和大灰狼
data.Sentence: like the sabretoothed cats and the giant wolves,

data.Sentence_cn: 就来吃大象，结果遭到了同样的命运。
data.Sentence: came out to feed and suffered exactly the same fate.

data.Sentence_cn: 沥青坑里还有无数只鸟的尸体。
data.Sentence: There are also endless numbers of birds in the tar as well.

title.title: The past life of the earth
